title: Compiler crash: 'assertion failed: self.scc_universes[scc] == ty::UniverseIndex::ROOT'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This appears to be the same assertion as #100818, #97099, and #103186 (though I'm unclear if the cause is the same) occurring on both stable rust 1.65.0 and nightly 1.67.0. The below reproduction is as minimal as I could get it. Worth noting that I don't believe this code would compile even without the ICE. ### Code ```Rust use core::future::Future; pub struct Struct where F: Fn(&C) -> Fu, Fu: Future, { handler: F, context: C, } impl Struct where F: Fn(&C) -> Fu, Fu: Future, { pub const fn new(handler: F, context: C) -> Self { Self { handler, context } } } type TestC = &'static usize; type TestFu = impl Future; type TestF = impl Fn(&TestC) -> TestFu; type TestStruct = Struct; async fn test_handler(context: &TestC) -> () { () } fn get_test_struct() -> &'static TestStruct { static test_actor: TestStruct = TestStruct::new(test_handler, &0); &test_actor } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: 897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120 commit-date: 2022-11-02 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.65.0 LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: self.scc_universes[scc] == ty::UniverseIndex::ROOT', compiler\rustc_borrowck\src\region_infer\mod.rs:721:9 ```
Backtrace
